source: Kuna jai mooza ipeeka upejikeene kui’elewa kuhusu aka bhirusi bhya kud’a
translated: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

source: Kaag hatua. Mita 2 ikud’uuna kukweeka usalaama na mata/ikololo yat’innkie.
translated: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

source: Kwa aka iyyo guya oone mûûdû akokololee/hat’iseeni
translated: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

source: Wanyiige kyiizi.  Wakokololela dhini ama kuhat’isîza dhini na wakiinge waalya chwee waa bira yaao
translated: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

source: Anaafi daa moroghoti, nijai akukingee mîîlî
translated: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

source: Waad waalya wa’ambukizizwe wakud’una kochowa konyisa d’alili, amû yiite wanaa maambukizi
translated: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

source: Na kwa uj’umula, ni fai kukaagî kla na ummati wa waadû, maana da’ukud’uuna kumanya katî kaao ni ani yûû moroghoti.
translated: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

source: Na hata na b’atiini ya oso wa  kyiizi kyewwe
translated: & even on the outside of your face mask

source: J’apokuwa wakati ûgî mataa mûûdû moroghoti yakud’uuna kut’innik’îla biyya zîgî…
translated: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

source: Na guya udhaabhi b’llaa kutarazia b’aadhyaa sehemu îzi, na kisaana ukadhaabha oso wewwe,
translated: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

source: Na gîla mooza muhimu hamu ya kuwamala ni kwa koosa na kuwacheeja na sab’uni, jiiki, ama boorte.
translated: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

source: Bhirusi nijai bhikakaagî hubhîîni kwa mud’aa masa’a bhit’ook’o
translated: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

source: Dûû manaa yûû muhimu kweera aya
translated: Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here

source: Manya usaadhaabha oso wewwe. (ama oso wa mûûdû ûgî.) Guya yaakukub’idhi, osa nguzi mikono yewwe aka fai na sab’uni.
translated: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

source: Mud’a mufai wa koghoona ubhinaa ‘Sikwaa kubhyaalîka’ mara bîlî.
translated: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
wash the back of your hands

source: Guya ugheghezie aka iyyo, uswiite na wasiwasi. Ukisaana osa mikono yewwe na sab’uni.
translated: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

source: Manya usaadhaabha kyiizi ikyo na b’atiini.
translated: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

source: *Bakiteria nijai zika’enea kyiizi ikyo dhini guya ukifaazie kyiizi ikyo kwa mud’a mulaila
translated: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

source: Llacha kyiizi guya oone kit’uraawie. Manya usaakufaala kyiizi ikyo zaid’yaa siku mooza!
translated: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

source: Killaa mûûdû ipejikeene akwiita na taulwaa koowa yeyye mweenye.
Manya musaakulubhana ama kutumika wali bhiitû, hubhî, bhikombe, taulu.
translated: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

source: Maana da’ud’uuna udhaabhe oso wewwe na chik’ilî hata guya uwakud’eema
translated: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

source: Guya iwakud’unikana arhûlla na ufuuge babala ikiwa utumikee ch’ik’ilî yewwe ama ifuzi lyewwe bad’ilyaa kutumika mokono wewwe.
translated: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

source: Na hata ba’ad’a kwiita b’atiini na wadûû
translated: and after being out in the public

source: Osa mikono yewwe na maazî na sab’uni killaa wakati…
translated: Always wash your hands with soap…

source: Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!
Soma nakala îyî ud’ak’abhe kumanya udhiina
translated: Read the articles for more tips!

source: “This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
translated: This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz
question: in Business Insider (Jan 21

source: “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)
translated: The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe"
question: by Laurie Garrett

source: “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)
translated: How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands"
question: by Elizabeth Rosenthal

source: Kifungu kya koogeza: Kuzingatia usafi kwa umakiini kwa komiki kuna umuhimu wa kwiizîza ma’ambukizi yagî yamanyikeene kamaa k’annû na bepo, na ipejikeene kuzingatiywa na kutekelezwa katîka maisha ya killaa siku, hata guya kusakoona j’anga lya roghoti.  References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10 Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart  Kwaaba mwoongozo Umma kwa uj’umula nijai wakapeewa Komiki  îyî b’asi aka wakuitumika mitandao yaao dhini ya Whatsapp na  Telegramu, na kupakua kweyye lîa ni b’asi aka id’una kuchapishwa aka ikweekwa mab’angooni dûû waadû wakutumika binasu ama itumike kwa golaa kubarsiisisa mizîni, sukuli na hata  biyyaa ghiiryû balîî balî.  Guya okonyisee wagî, ûkûcha rhaalî zingatia mambo aya matato: 1) Da’irughusizwe kwa aka yoyote kuhariiri komiki wakati utumikee na wagî. 2) Komiki da’itumikee kwa murad’i wowote wa kib’yashara 3) Guya yûû mutandaoni, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow Kwa waalya wagî chwee watumikee, mûkûcha rhaallî botaa ombi lyeenu kwa: comicsforgood@gmail.com
translated: Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic.  References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVI 019 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-1O Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart  Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces.  When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow ﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow

source: Kuhusu bhirusi bhya Kud’a  Translated by Fatuma Ali  Kuna jai mooza ipeeka upejikeene kui’elewa kuhusu aka bhirusi bhya kud’a KU’ENEE Kanweeni Bûleeni Machooni yakakupacha Mûûdû anaa jinna fai Mûûdû moroghoti Bhirusi bhika’enea guya mata yakut’innik’île Kaag hatua. Mita 2 ikud’uuna kukweeka usalaama na mata/ikololo yat’innkie. 1 ûzî Hat’isoo! Kwa aka iyyo guya oone mûûdû akokololee/hat’iseeni Wanyiige kyiizi.  Wakokololela dhini ama kuhat’isîza dhini na wakiinge waalya chwee waa bira yaao 2 Ni asanta *Shub’a uvunîka* Ama Anaafi daa moroghoti, nijai akukingee mîîlî Waad waalya wa’ambukizizwe wakud’una kochowa konyisa d’alili, amû yiite wanaa maambukizi Na kwa uj’umula, ni fai kukaagî kla na ummati wa waadû, maana da’ukud’uuna kumanya katî kaao ni ani yûû moroghoti. Bhipod’ozi Mûûdû anaa jinna fai Masîîrimo za tireni Bhifuungo bhya kûchîza izûlû Tishu Bhikombe Bhifaa bhya dijitali Na hata na b’atiini ya oso wa  kyiizi kyewwe Mab’ango ya staa Banya Kalamu Kichapi kya babala Mikono yaao J’apokuwa wakati ûgî mataa mûûdû moroghoti yakud’uuna kut’innik’îla biyya zîgî… anyî chwee mukud’uuna kulwaala ama oswaa mud’ala ywewwe ukashukuma macho Na guya udhaabhi b’llaa kutarazia b’aadhyaa sehemu îzi, na kisaana ukadhaabha oso wewwe, Na gîla mooza muhimu hamu ya kuwamala ni kwa koosa na kuwacheeja na sab’uni, jiiki, ama boorte. Bhirusi nijai bhikakaagî hubhîîni kwa mud’aa masa’a bhit’ook’o Sab’uni Tahadhari Dûû manaa yûû muhimu kweera aya Osa na sab’uni mupakaa apo Sab’uni Chik’ilî Manya usaadhaabha oso wewwe. (ama oso wa mûûdû ûgî.) Guya yaakukub’idhi, osa nguzi mikono yewwe aka fai na sab’uni. Mud’a mufai wa koghoona ubhinaa ‘Sikwaa kubhyaalîka’ mara bîlî. Gobera mibeeni Kwa mud’aa sekunde 20 Kaarha za nyalimo Osa nyumaa mikono yewwe Kusafisa hamu ikama’nisha jîîza? Guya ugheghezie aka iyyo, uswiite na wasiwasi. Ukisaana osa mikono yewwe na sab’uni. Manya usaadhaabha kyiizi ikyo na b’atiini. Mata/ikololo *Bakiteria nijai zika’enea kyiizi ikyo dhini guya ukifaazie kyiizi ikyo kwa mud’a mulaila Llacha kyiizi guya oone kit’uraawie. Manya usaakufaala kyiizi ikyo zaid’yaa siku mooza! Tumia mok’aa kupakua bhiitû D’aana Baaba Aaî Killaa mûûdû ipejikeene akwiita na taulwaa koowa yeyye mweenye. Manya musaakulubhana ama kutumika wali bhiitû, hubhî, bhikombe, taulu. Maana da’ud’uuna udhaabhe oso wewwe na chik’ilî hata guya uwakud’eema Guya iwakud’unikana arhûlla na ufuuge babala ikiwa utumikee ch’ik’ilî yewwe ama ifuzi lyewwe bad’ilyaa kutumika mokono wewwe. Muzîni Na hata ba’ad’a kwiita b’atiini na wadûû Kab’ullaa usaakûlya bhiitû Osa mikono yewwe na maazî na sab’uni killaa wakati… Na mwiisho Sab’uni Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!   Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!   Sab’uni Soma nakala îyî ud’ak’abhe kumanya udhiina “This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)  “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)  “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)  K’aasisa muhimu ya laghwaa madawa Kifungu kya koogeza: Kuzingatia usafi kwa umakiini kwa komiki kuna umuhimu wa kwiizîza ma’ambukizi yagî yamanyikeene kamaa k’annû na bepo, na ipejikeene kuzingatiywa na kutekelezwa katîka maisha ya killaa siku, hata guya kusakoona j’anga lya roghoti.  References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10 Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart  Kwaaba mwoongozo Umma kwa uj’umula nijai wakapeewa Komiki  îyî b’asi aka wakuitumika mitandao yaao dhini ya Whatsapp na  Telegramu, na kupakua kweyye lîa ni b’asi aka id’una kuchapishwa aka ikweekwa mab’angooni dûû waadû wakutumika binasu ama itumike kwa golaa kubarsiisisa mizîni, sukuli na hata  biyyaa ghiiryû balîî balî.  Guya okonyisee wagî, ûkûcha rhaalî zingatia mambo aya matato: 1) Da’irughusizwe kwa aka yoyote kuhariiri komiki wakati utumikee na wagî. 2) Komiki da’itumikee kwa murad’i wowote wa kib’yashara 3) Guya yûû mutandaoni, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow Kwa waalya wagî chwee watumikee, mûkûcha rhaallî botaa ombi lyeenu kwa: comicsforgood@gmail.com Kuhusu bhirusi bhya Kud’a
translated: About Coronavirus    There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus SPREADS Mouth Nose Eyes Get into your Healthy Person Sick Person The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets. 1 2m-0.5m Achoo! So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby 2 Thank you﻿*sniffles* OR, Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick. chopsticks Healthy person Train straps Lift buttons Tissues Cups Digital devices & even on the outside of your face mask Stair bannisters Mouse Pens Door knobs Their hands However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things… you might all fall sick. or your loved one's face rub eyes And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face, and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol. Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects, soap precautions Which is why it is also good to follow these wash with soap up to here soap elbow Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first. Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice under the nails for 20 seconds between the fingers wash the back of your hands What is thoroughly? If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after. Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can. droplets *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day! Use a serving spoon Baby Daddy Mommy Everyone gets their own towel Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels. You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible. Home and after being out in the public Before you eat Always wash your hands with soap… And finally, soap Stay safe, everyone! Stay safe, everyone! soap Read the articles for more tips! This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz
